title: A Conversation with Wilson Bryan Key
creator_contributor_role: Northern Virginia Community College. Extended Learning Institute, production company
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Advertising - Social aspects
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Advertising photography - Social aspect
description: Episode number 9 of Series "The Developing image". Dr. Key is a professor of Media Studies and president of Media Probe, a centre for the study of Media. Dr. Key attempts to awaken the public to the real message behind the innumerable photographic images which surround us. This fascinating discussion focuses on subliminal advertising, and how millions of dollars are spent each year for the solitary purpose of persuading consumers to buy a product.
